items.name: UInsure
items.title: Principal Developer
items.description: My current role is as a principal developer in a small highly skilled team.  I'll be working closely with the lead developer exploring better ways of working, more maintainable patterns and practices while helping bring these changes into the team.

items.name: Digigoach Ltd
items.title: Director / Consultant
items.description:
Mojo Mortgages (2019-2020)
Spent time working at Mojo as a consultant working through a list of small projects including refactoring and 3rd party integrations

items.name: AND Digital
items.title: Product Developer L5
items.description:
Hired as a senior software engineer to work on client projects as a consultant.  Working within teams in whichever capacity is required.
Focussed on.net and angular for previous clients, pushed for (and prototyped) several approaches to automated testing in legacy systems.
Helped architect a secure, scale-able and low maintenance solution for a client on a relatively tight deadline.
Participated in a small product development sprint creating an Alexa Voice skill and participated in a couple of Google Design sprints.

items.name: Shield Safety Group/ Dynamic Risk Indicator
items.title: Senior Software Developer
items.description:
Initially hired as a senior software developer to lead a team I finished my time in a "dev ops" squad as a technical specialist.
My original role was to lead a team of 2 juniors in 2-weekly sprints working on modules of Compliance Centre. I spent time looking after the sprint as a whole while mentoring and helping my team.  While working here I helped challenge processes and practices to enable better development and helped for a team culture of maintainable and testable code first.
I also tried to foster a "no stupid questions" for my team to enable everyone to participate in discussions and technical suggestions.
I spent a lot of time working with the development manager exploring different approached to TDD and beginning a journey of DDD.
As a member of the dev ops team, I spent time hunting down significant technical and performance issues within the systems.

items.name: Carfinance 247
items.title: Web Developer
items.description:
I worked with a large team of developers on internal tools for the companies sales teams.  My work day was split between active feature development on the areas of software my sub-team held responsibility for and bug fixing and change requests on the legacy software we were working to replace.  Our team implemented a legacy rota to distribute time spent on bug fixing fairly.
I spent time championing unit testing and good software practices while helping junior team members with problems.

items.name: Sage UK
items.title: Web Developer
items.description:
I worked with a team of tax and UI specialists to help build CT Online.  An online tool for small businesses to record and process their corporation tax.  We worked primarily in angularjs and ruby-on-rails.
The team worked in an agile manner participating in sprint planning, scrums, retrospectives and daily stand-ups.  We had some interactions with other teams as certain parts of the software interacted with other components.

items.name: Web Applications UK
items.title: Software Engineer
items.description:
My time at WebApps was mostly spend pair programming while developing a natural language querying system for their in-development software.
 I spent the rest of my time working to support their legacy software

items.name: System C Healthcare
items.title: Software Developer
items.description:
I was part of a small team that managed 4 out of many modules in their application suites.
System C operated in an agile environment with very large N-tier enterprise software.  While slightly different to previous agile methodologies, this was my first foray into a more formal agile methodology.

items.name: DriveWorks Ltd
items.title: Software Developer
items.description:
As the 3D developer at DriveWorks my main responsibilities were to help create and maintain their 3D applications targeted at Desktop, Mobile and Web.  This required a large degree of confidence and autonomy.  I had a fair amount of help from the lead developer but this was a mostly solitary project.
I was also responsible for my share of bug fixes within the main application suite.  I participated in an "on call" rota, which was a chance for each developer to spend time supporting technical staff in diagnosing customer issues.
My greatest achievment was getting the mobile apps onto their respective stores.  This was a multi-person achievement but being a driving force did feel pretty amazing.

items.name: University of Huddersfield
items.title: Computer Games Programming Graduate BSc (Hons)
items.description:
I applied to study computer games programming because I struggled to learn to code on my own, this seemed like a fun and practical course on programming.
I benefited more than I would have from a Comp Sci degree I think as the course was predominantly practical and we studied a myriad of languages including Java, C# and C++.
